page.title: 16Trentham Church - 1
page.content: The present building, dedicated to St. Mary and All Saints, dates from the early twelfth century, being extensively rebuilt in 1844. It was once part of the Sutherland family estate but now serves a growing parish of new homes. A yew tree reputed to be 1300 years old and the base of a cross dedicated to St. Werburgh in 875 A.D. may be seen. Some Jacobean silver Communion ware is kept in the church and Charles I Coat of Arms, with Cromwellian bullet holes, hangs over the North door. A new vestry was built in 1933 and extended in 1967. In 1982 the Church Centre was built. Since the Domesday book there have been 42 priests and priors, but at the moment the parish is awaiting the appointment of a new vicar.
